# count_char { #pytest1.count_char }

```python
count_char(input_string)
```

Count the number of characters in a string.

## Parameters {.doc-section .doc-section-parameters}

| Name         | Type   | Description                          | Default    |
|--------------|--------|--------------------------------------|------------|
| input_string | str    | The string to count characters from. | _required_ |

## Returns {.doc-section .doc-section-returns}

| Name   | Type   | Description                                   |
|--------|--------|-----------------------------------------------|
|        | int    | The number of characters in the input string. |

## Raises {.doc-section .doc-section-raises}

| Name   | Type      | Description                         |
|--------|-----------|-------------------------------------|
|        | TypeError | If input_string is not of type str. |

## Examples {.doc-section .doc-section-examples}

```python
>>> count_char("hello")
5
>>> count_char("")
0
>>> count_char("hello world")
11
```
